intro: Limonium sokotranum, commonly known as the Sokotra bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a notable species in botanical studies. The flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
